name: Regular Bracket Sequence
description:
A bracket sequence is called regular if it is possible to obtain correct
arithmetic expression by inserting characters «+» and «1» into this sequence.
For example, sequences «(())()», «()» and «(()(()))» are regular, while «)(»,
«(()» and «(()))(» are not. One day Johnny got bracket sequence. He decided to
remove some of the brackets from it in order to obtain a regular bracket
sequence. What is the maximum length of a regular bracket sequence which can
be obtained? Input Input consists of a single line with non-empty string of
«(» and «)» characters. Its length does not exceed 10^6. Output Output the
maximum possible length of a regular bracket sequence. Examples Input (()))(
Output 4 Input ((()()) Output 6
